alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 9:15AM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of rain and snow above 6500 feet, all snow above 7000 feet. Snow showers may become heavy at times again this afternoon. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches above 6500 feet, with locally higher totals above 7500-8000 ft. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Heber-Overgaard and Williams. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Additional snow forecast from 9 AM Today to 5 PM Today: Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 1 to 2 inches Forest Lakes 1 to 3 inches Heber-Overgaard 0 inches Williams 0 to 1 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Western Mogollon Rim
